description: US President Joe Biden said he’s pushing for a six-week pause in fighting between Israel and Hamas to allow for the release of hostages, saying those conditions could lay the groundwork for broader peace.
title: Biden Pushes for Six-Week Fighting Pause in Israel-Hamas Hostage Deal

description: The US asked a judge for permission to sell a $300 million superyacht that allegedly belongs to Russian billionaire Suleiman Kerimov and was seized under sanctions imposed in the wake of the war in Ukraine.
title: Seized Russian Superyacht May Be Sold Over $600,000 Monthly Tab

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Erik Wasson looks at the next big hurdle for lawmakers. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Ukraine Aid Debate Obscures Looming Spending Fight, Shutdown Risk

description: A Georgia judge ordered a two-day hearing this week to determine whether he should disqualify District Attorney Fani Willis from the racketeering case against Donald Trump because she had a romantic relationship with the lead prosecutor.
title: Trump Judge Orders Hearing on Fani Willis Affair With Prosecutor

description: Donald Trump asked the US Supreme Court to keep on hold his criminal trial for trying to overturn the 2020 election while he appeals a ruling that rejected his bid for immunity from prosecution.
title: Trump Asks Supreme Court to Keep DC Criminal Trial on Hold

description: Six months into the job, Thailand’s first civilian leader in a decade is running into roadblocks as he tries to deliver on election promises to lift the economy out of its decade of sub 2% growth rates.
title: Srettha’s Standoff With Central Bank Risks Thailand’s Economic Turnaround

description: The bipartisan leaders of a key House committee charged with curbing the influence of China’s ruling party expressed concern Monday at President Joe Biden’s campaign outreach over a Chinese-owned social media channel.
title: Biden’s TikTok Foray Spurs Bipartisan Angst at House China Panel

description: Columbia University became the latest school to come under scrutiny by a US House committee over its response to antisemitism on campus, as the panel widens an inquiry beyond two Ivy League colleges that have both replaced their presidents.
title: Columbia Added to House Antisemitism Probe of Ivy League

description: Transatlantic ties are essential and will prevail irrespective of November’s US presidential election results, according to German Finance Minister Christian Lindner.
title: Germany’s Lindner Says US Ties Are Key No Matter Election Result

description: The Labour Party withdrew support from its candidate to fill a vacant Parliament seat in northern England, caving to pressure to cut ties with Azhar Ali over antisemitic remarks he was reported to have made last year.
title: Labour Withdraws Support for Candidate in Antisemitism Scandal

description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin was put under general anesthesia for a procedure to address a bladder problem, his doctors said, as concern continued to swirl around his heath after his second hospitalization in a month.
title: Pentagon Chief Austin Goes Under Anesthesia to Treat Bladder Issue

description: The chief prosecutor of the International Criminal Court warned Israel to follow international law in Gaza and said that his office is investigating the conflict “as a matter of the utmost urgency.”
title: Israel Warned by ICC Prosecutor Over Gaza Conduct After Rafah Strike

description: South Africa will deploy 2,900 troops to help fight armed groups in the east of the Democratic Republic of Congo as part of a Southern African Development Community initiative.
title: South Africa to Deploy 2,900 Troops to Eastern Congo

description: Volodymyr Zelenskiy is planning a tour of Western European capitals around this week’s Munich Security Conference, according to people with knowledge of the matter, as the Ukrainian president seeks military support amid the funding fight in Washington.
title: Zelenskiy Plans Western European Tour to Lobby for Ukraine Aid

description: Geert Wilders’ path to forming a government has been hindered by disagreements over constitutional guarantees, the lead Dutch coalition negotiator said.
title: Wilders-Led Dutch Government Is at Risk Over Constitutional Concern

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz blasted comments by Donald Trump questioning US commitments to defending NATO allies in case they were attacked, saying the position endangers Europe.
title: Scholz Slams Trump NATO Stance as ‘Irresponsible, Dangerous’

description: Iceland’s government has agreed to buy all residential properties in the fishing town of Grindavik, which has become uninhabitable after three volcanic eruptions rocked the region in the last two months.
title: Iceland Plans to Buy Out Home Owners in Volcano-Struck Town

description: Pope Francis meets Javier Milei in Vatican City, on Feb. 12. Photographer: Vatican Pool/Getty Images
title: Milei Praises Pope in Reversal After Vatican Meeting

description: The European Union has proposed new trade restrictions on about two dozen firms, including three based in China, accused of supporting Russia’s war efforts in Ukraine.
title: EU Proposes Curbs on Three Chinese Firms for Aiding Russia

description: The biggest risks to South Africa’s 2024 economic outlook may come from insufficient power supply, strains on debt sustainability and the erosion of state legitimacy ahead of elections, according to Allianz SE.
title: Power Cuts, Debt Pose Biggest Risks to South Africa’s Economic Outlook

description: Scrapping stamp duty on shares would be a key step to help revive Britain’s flailing stock market, according to analysis by Peel Hunt, which predicts that such a move would boost investment inflows and encourage more companies to list in London.
title: Scrap Stamp Duty on UK Shares to Boost Market, Peel Hunt Urges

description: Republican presidential hopeful Nikki Haley described as “ludicrous” former President Donald Trump’s support for across-the-board tariffs on imports — as well as a 60% levy on Chinese goods — saying such a move would hurt American consumers.
title: Haley Calls Trump Bid for Heavy Tariffs on Imports ‘Ludicrous’

description: Elon Musk’s Starlink satellite internet service is being used by Sudan’s paramilitary Rapid Support Forces amid a nationwide internet blackout that humanitarian agencies say is preventing people from accessing essential help during a brutal 10-month civil war.
title: Musk’s Starlink Used by Sudan Paramilitary Group Amid Internet Blackout

description: Nikki Haley criticized Donald Trump’s populist stance toward NATO as well as his pledge to increase tariffs on China and other countries, attacking two of the central tenets of the former president’s argument for a return to the White House in 2024.
title: Haley Assails Trump Over NATO, Tariffs in Bid to Close 2024 Gap

description: A shooter killed three people at the offices of a shipping company in the Athens suburb of Glyfada on Monday before taking his own life, Greek police said.
title: Gunman Kills Three at Greek Shipper European Navigation

description: Ukrainian authorities accused Russia of seeking to undermine its new military chief with a spate of media portrayals highlighting the general’s past in Russia as a Soviet officer.
title: Ukraine Says Army Chief Targeted in Russian Smear Campaign

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Trump, Take Two: US Presidential Hopeful's Influence on UK Foreign Policy

description: The UK’s decision to leave the European Union shrank the British economy by reducing growth and spurring higher inflation, according to economists at Goldman Sachs Group Inc. who compared the country’s performance to similar nations since the referendum in 2016.
title: Goldman Says UK Economy Suffering ‘Long-Term’ Cost of Brexit

description: South Africa dismissed a bid by US lawmakers to have legislation passed that calls for a review of bilateral ties between the two nations.
title: South Africa Dismisses US Lawmakers’ Bid to Review Relations

description: The ads are negative and hard to escape.
title: Wealthiest NYC Suburb Splits Over What’s Next After Santos Mess

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban will look to move past one of the biggest crises of his 14-year rule after the shock resignation of the country’s head of state over a child sex-abuse case exposed cracks inside his well-oiled political machine.
title: Orban to Tackle Political Crisis After Hungarian President Quits

description: Poland plans to inspect grain shipments from Ukraine after farmers blockaded border crossings and Prime Minister Donald Tusk vowed to defend domestic producers against unfair competition.
title: Poland to Inspect Ukraine’s Grain as Border Tensions Grow

description: Germany’s economy would be ruined if it followed the UK out of the European Union as the far-right Alternative for Germany party has proposed, according to Finance Minister Christian Lindner.
title: German Finance Chief Warns of ‘Ruinous’ Impact of Leaving EU

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump’s NATO Taunts Shock But No Longer Awe

description: A Dutch court ordered the Netherlands to halt shipments of F-35 fighter jet parts to Israel, citing a “clear risk” of human-rights law violations amid the ongoing military assault in the Gaza Strip.
title: Dutch Court Orders Halt of F-35 Parts Shipment to Israel

description: Zimbabwe may back its currency with gold in an effort to end exchange-rate instability, Finance Minister Mthuli Ncube said.
title: Zimbabwe’s Government Considers Using Gold to Back Its Currency

description: France will halt a government-subsidized electric vehicle leasing program for the remainder of 2024 after more people than originally targeted applied for it, Agence France-Presse reported.
title: France to Halt 2024 Subsidized EV Leases Over High Demand: AFP

description: UK opposition Labour Party leader Keir Starmer faces pressure from political opponents to drop his candidate for this month’s parliamentary election in northern England after they were recorded sharing an antisemitic conspiracy theory about the Oct. 7 attack by Hamas on Israel.
title: UK Labour Party Under Pressure to Drop Candidate Over Antisemitic Remarks

description: A stonefaced Mitch McConnell walked onto the Senate floor on Sunday to push back against isolationists in his party, mere hours after Donald Trump cast serious doubt on the strength of US alliances.
title: Waning McConnell Is Last GOP Bulwark Against Trump Isolationism

description: Kosovo’s prime minister stood by new regulations on enforcing the euro as the country’s sole currency, which have been criticized by the US and European Union as disrupting cash assistance to ethnic Serbs using the dinar.
title: Kosovo Premier Says New Rules on Euro Use Are Here to Stay

description: Abu Dhabi’s G42 is preparing to pare back its presence in China, a top executive said, amid reports of growing US concerns over the artificial intelligence firm’s ties to Beijing.
title: Abu Dhabi AI Firm G42 to Pare Back China Presence in Pivot to US

description: The impact of a 60% tax on Chinese imports.
title: How a Second Trump Administration Could Upend US-China Relations

description: It took the worst energy crisis in generations, but Europe has finally managed to begin easing the gridlock of paperwork that has long stalled the development of onshore wind farms.
title: Wind Power Is Breaking Free of European Bureaucracy

description: Houthi militants targeted the Star Iris with “suitable naval missiles” in the Red Sea, Yahya Saree, a spokesman for the Iran-backed group, said in a statement posted on X.
title: Houthis Say They Hit Ship Owned by US-Listed Firm in Red Sea

description: Saudi Aramco’s decision to halt an expansion of its output capacity is because of the energy transition, Energy Minister Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman said.
title: Aramco’s Capacity Halt Due to Energy Transition, Minister Says

description: The Danish government has reached a deal with labor unions, agreeing to an 8.8% increase in salaries over two years for a range of state employees from military personnel to high school teachers
title: Danish Government Reaches Wage Deal With State Labor Unions

description: Philippines President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. will address a rare joint sitting of Australia’s parliament in a sign of Canberra’s deepening ties with Southeast Asian nations at a time of strategic competition in the region.
title: Philippines’ President Marcos to Give Rare Speech to Australia’s Parliament

description: The three parties in Germany’s unpopular ruling coalition suffered losses in Sunday’s partial repeat in Berlin of the 2021 federal election, continuing a national trend that is likely to be repeated in four key votes this year.
title: German Coalition Punished in Repeat of 2021 Election in Berlin

description: Pakistan’s two main family-controlled political parties are drawing closer to forming a coalition government that would thwart Imran Khan’s group, even after the jailed former cricket star’s candidates won the most seats in the country’s contentious election.
title: Pakistan’s Old Guard Parties Near Coalition Deal to Thwart Khan

description: President Joe Biden’s reelection campaign has launched a TikTok account in a bid to reach younger voters, a move that comes as the popular short-form video platform confronts concerns over its ties to China.
title: Biden’s Reelection Campaign Joins TikTok to Reach Young Voters

description: Israel Defense Forces conducted strikes early Monday morning on the city of Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip, where more than 1 million people have sought shelter from the fighting.
title: Israel Conducts Strikes in Rafah as Humanitarian Concerns Mount

description: Qatar released eight former Indian navy personnel who were facing death sentences in a case related to alleged spying.
title: Qatar Releases Eight Former Indian Navy Officials on Death Row
